page.title: 18Life styles in Stock
page.content: Mrs Kitchen the licensee of the Hoop showed us a letter which was written between 1790 and 1795.It came from a girl's employer who lived in London and enquired about the welfare of her child.The letter was addresed to Thomas Jarvis a local builder and it was probable that he used it to plug a gap while he was constructing the tavern's walls.They had a very pleasant beer garden equipped with play gear. The Hoop is a lovely, companionable village pub with strong sporting elements as the head quarters of the Stock Football and Dart Clubs.
